Summary: The request is to rezone from OR20 to MUL-A-NS for a property located at 600 40th Ave. N, corner of Delaware Ave and 40th Ave. N, for mixed-use development on 0.26 acres.
Community character policy: T4 Urban Mixed Use Neighborhood (T4 MU)
Applicant: SWS Engineering, applicant; GMAT Holdings, GP, owner
Staff recommendation description: Staff recommends approval. Staff finds the proposed mixed use zoning district to be consistent with the Urban Mixed Use Neighborhood policy applied to the site. The land uses permitted in MUL-A are consistent with the policies intent to create urban, mixed use neighborhoods with a diverse mix of land uses. The bulk standards of the MUL-A zoning district require an urban form be provided with any future development with vehicle access limited to alleyways and buildings built near the sidewalk to provide an appropriate pedestrian realm. Staff finds the proposed MUL-A zoning district to be appropriate given the policy and context of the site.
Location description: northeast corner of Delaware Avenue and 40th Ave. N

Summary: Request to rezone from AR2a and RS15 to IR for properties located at 4520 Ashland City Highway and Cato Road, covering 27.58 acres. Staff recommends disapproval due to policy inconsistency.
Requested by: Thomas & Hutton, Eskimo Ashland and Church of the Living God, the Pillar and Ground of the Truth, Trustees.
Applicant: Thomas & Hutton; Eskimo Ashland and Church of the Living God, the Pillar and Ground of the Truth, Trustees.
Staff recommendation description: Staff recommends disapproval. Portions of the site are located within CO policy, recognizing areas of steep slopes and streams with associated buffers that bisect the site. Most of the properties are within T2 RM policy which only supports residential uses that are rural in character. The proposed IR zoning permits non-residential uses, including industrial and manufacturing uses, that are incompatible with the goals of the applied policy. Given the inconsistency with policy, staff recommends disapproval.
Location description: Located at 4520 Ashland City Highway and Cato Road (unnumbered), approximately 825 feet east of Amy Lynn Drive (27.58 acres)

Summary: Staff recommends disapproval because the proposed IR zoning is inconsistent with the CO and T2 RM policies.
Applicant: Thomas & Hutton, applicant; Eskimo Ashland and Church of the Living God, the Pillar and Ground of the Truth, Trustees, owners
Staff recommendation description: Staff recommends disapproval. Portions of the site are located within CO policy, recognizing areas of steep slope and streams with associated buffers that bisect the site. Most of the properties are within T2 RM policy which only supports residential uses that are rural in character. The proposed IR zoning permits non-residential uses, including industrial and manufacturing uses, that are incompatible with the goals of the applied policy. Given the inconsistency with policy, staff recommends disapproval.
Location description: north side of Ashland City Highway, northeast of the intersection of Ashland City Highway and Briley Parkway, adjacent to Briley Parkway

Summary: Request to rezone from MUL to AR2a for a property at the southeastern intersection of Mt. View and Crossings Blvd. The staff recommends disapproval.
Requested by: Councilmember Joy Styles; Rajendra Bhakta, owner
Applicant: Councilmember Joy Styles; Rajendra Bhakta, owner
Staff recommendation description: Staff finds the proposed AR2a zoning to be inconsistent with the intent of the T3 CM policy to encourage a greater mix of higher-density residential and commercial uses in a suburban form. The proposed AR2a zoning does not permit the land uses or the development pattern intended for the T3 CM policy. T3 CM intends for commercial uses to be located at intersections, and the subject site is located at a prominent intersection of two Arterial Boulevards in a First Tier Center. AR2a permits very low-intensity development and would permit a maximum of 2 residential units with very limited, primarily agricultural, non-residential land uses. AR2a also permits potentially inappropriate land uses for this policy and context such as waste management. Staff finds the proposed AR2a zoning district to be inappropriate given the policy and context of the site and recommends disapproval.
Location description: Property located at the southeastern intersection of Mt. View Road and Crossings Boulevard (2.13 acres).
